result.execSummary:
The defendant Robbie L Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,395.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to apply if applicable.  Payable first during Extended Supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
All court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution: to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.   Take all prescribed medications.
No drugs or alcohol.  No firearms, weapons.

Cognitive intervention programming.
Watch a TED talk on the computer.
*Successfully complete anger management and continue programming.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Received and filed, (7) letters on behalf of the defendant. lms

Defendant Robbie L Fields in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Defendant Robbie L Fields in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Kayla G., Latonia W. and Sheila M.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 40 YEARS, with credit for 210 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Successfully complete Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Watch a TED talk on the computer.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Restitution payable to Crime Victim Compensation for $1,395.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.
Exhibit List received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
At the hour of 4:23 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Count 1 which was then read.
Stipulation regarding DVD foundation received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Robbie L Fields in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled at 1:53 pm.  Stipulation regarding DVD foundation received and filed.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.  Defense motion to dismiss denied by the Court.  Jury in the box.  Stipulation placed on the record.  Video of interview of state's witness Ty-ron D. played.  Detective who conducted interview was not available to testify on behalf of defense.  Defense rests.  Jury out of the box at 2:32 pm.  Discussion regarding jury instructions.  Jury in the box at 2:38 pm.  Court grants defense request to reopen their case.  Exhibit 22 marked, offered into evidence by defense and received by the Court.  Closing instructions on the law.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  State's rebuttal arguments.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:23 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputies Arredondo and Sanfilipo who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Case recalled at 4:21 pm.  At the hour of 4:23 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Count 1 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict, and denied defense motion for directed verdict and defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing on 1/6/16 at 8:30 am in Branch 6.

Defendant Robbie L Fields in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled at 10:02 am.  Discussion regarding relevant witness convictions.  Discussion regarding juror who was in an auto accident this morning and should be arriving shortly.  Jury in the box at 10:11 am.  Exhibit 3 offered into evidence by the state and received by the Court.   Sworn for the state: Detective Marlon Davis of Milwaukee Police Department on direct examination.  Exhibits 10-21, marked, offered into evidence by the state, received by the Court and published.  Cross-examination by defense.  Redirect by the state.  Re-cross by defense.  Sworn for the state: Deasia C. on direct examination.  Cross-examination by defense.  Sworn for the state: Ty-ron D. on direct examination.  Cross-examination by defense.  Sworn for the state: Officer Jonathan Jenkins of Milwaukee Police Department on direct examination.  Cross-examination by defense.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box.  Off the record discussion placed on the record.  Jury in the box.  Court excused jury for lunch and told them to return at 1:30 pm.
Jury List received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Robbie L Fields in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled at 1:30 pm.  Discussion regarding security issues.  Court requested additional deputy to remain in the gallery during this afternoon's proceedings.

Case recalled at 1:37 pm.  Jury in the box at 1:40 pm.  Voir dire resumed.  Jury out of the box at 2:25 pm.  Juror #8 struck for cause.  Jury in the box at 2:33 pm.  Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn at 2:37 pm.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of the box.  Discussion regarding juror interaction and photos to be submitted as evidence.  Jury in the box at 2:58 pm.  Court instructed the jury on opening instructions on the law.  Sidebar.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Officer Anthony Martinez of Milwaukee Police Department on direct examination.   Exhibits 1-2 and 4-8 marked, offered into evidence by the state, received by the Court and published.  Exhibit 3 marked.  Cross-examination by defense.  Sworn for the state: Dr. Jacob Smith of Milwaukee County Medical Examiner's Office on direct examination.   Exhibit 9 marked, offered into evidence by the state and received by the Court.  Cross-examination by defense.  Sidebar.  Sworn for the state: Kayla G. on direct examination.  Court excused jury for the evening and told them to return at 9:15 am, 12/1/15.  Discussion regarding last witness.

Defendant Robbie L Fields in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled at 10:53 am.  Jury trial proceeded.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Discussion regarding witness convictions.  Jury panel in court and sworn at 11:30 am.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:32 am.  Court excused jury for lunch and told them to return at 1:30 pm.  Jury out of the box at 11:48 am.

Defendant Robbie L Fields in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.
Both parties are ready to proceed to trial today.  This case is one of two set for trial today that are ready to proceed.  Case passed while spin court is found for one of two cases.
